item.title: A bill to provide for the establishment of campaign medals to be awarded to members of the Armed Forces who participate in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S3458)

item.text: Became Public Law No: 108-234.
Became Public Law No: 108-234.
Signed by President.

Presented to President.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 98 - 0. Record Vote Number: 96.
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 98 - 0. Record Vote Number: 96.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S5566-5569)
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 507.
Committee on Armed Services. Reported by Senator Warner without amendment. Without written report.
Committee on Armed Services. Reported by Senator Warner without amendment. Without written report.
Committee on Armed Services. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 423 - 0 (Roll no. 102). (text: CR H1690)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 423 - 0 (Roll no. 102).(text: CR H1690)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H1712)

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3104.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H1690-1693)
Mr. Simmons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Executive Comment Requested from DOD.
Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

item.title: H.R. 3104, A bill to provide for the establishment of campaign medals to be awarded to members of the Armed Forces who participate in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom

item.title: H.R. 3104, A bill to provide for the establishment of campaign medals to be awarded to members of the Armed Forces who participate in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the House Committee on Armed Services on March 17, 2004

summary.text: Directs the President to establish separate campaign medals to recognize service by members of the armed forces in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Directs the President to establish separate campaign medals to recognize service by members of the uniformed services in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on March 30, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the President to establish separate campaign medals to recognize service by members of the uniformed services in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on March 30, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the President to establish separate campaign medals to recognize service by members of the uniformed services in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on March 30, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the President to establish separate campaign medals to recognize service by members of the uniformed services in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.

bill.title: To provide for the establishment of separate campaign medals to be awarded to members of the uniformed services who participate in Operation Enduring Freedom and to members of the uniformed services who participate in Operation Iraqi Freedom.

To provide for the establishment of campaign medals to be awarded to members of the Armed Forces who participate in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
